sn47.17:4.1: “Mendicants, when these four kinds of mindfulness meditation are developed and cultivated they are noble and emancipating, and bring one who practices them to the complete end of suffering.
sn47.17:4.3: It’s when a mendicant meditates by observing an aspect of the body, keen, aware, and mindful, rid of desire and aversion for the world.
sn47.17:4.4: They meditate by observing an aspect of feelings …
sn47.17:4.6: principles, keen, aware, and mindful, rid of desire and aversion for the world.
sn47.17:4.7: When these four kinds of mindfulness meditation are developed and cultivated they are noble and emancipating, and bring one who practices them to the complete end of suffering.”
